title: Can chronic illnesses be prevented in 2025? Five doctors from across the country give you 25 pro tips - The Indian Express
summary:
Five Doctors Reveal 25 Pro Tips to Prevent Chronic Illnesses by 2025

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: Indian Express

This article provides insights from five medical professionals offering practical tips for preventing chronic illnesses as we approach 2025. Emphasizing routines, mental health, and regular check-ups, the tips aim to optimize health and well-being.

  • Dr. Vijay Natarajan suggests creating 'me' time for mental health.
  • Set timers to encourage regular movement.
  • Check Vitamin D levels regularly to maintain overall health.
  • Focus on mental health as part of a holistic approach.
  • Ensure cardiac fitness with proper testing before starting fitness plans.
“Neglecting mental health can worsen health conditions.” - Dr. Vijay Natarajan

Overall, these tips highlight the importance of incorporating healthy habits into daily life, stressing that personal time and self-care are critical components in chronic illness prevention.

title: Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know - News18
summary:
Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 19:32 IST

Zepto, a quick commerce platform, is preparing to file its initial public offering (IPO) draft papers by March or April 2025, following approval to relocate its base from Singapore to India.

  • A critical board meeting on January 19 will discuss IPO specifics, including banker appointments and IPO size.
  • Grey market premium data will be available once IPO preparations begin, with pricing announced shortly before the IPO opening.
  • Zepto is set to become the first quick commerce startup to go public, following competitors like Zomato and Swiggy.
  • The company is shifting to a marketplace model for better quality control and service management.
  • Zepto reported a 120% increase in operating revenue to Rs 4,454 crore in FY24 and aims to expand operations to over 50 cities soon.
Zepto's valuation stands at USD 5 billion following a USD 350 million funding round in November 2024.

The upcoming IPO is a significant step for Zepto in its expansion journey and transformation into a competitive marketplace model.
newTitle: Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know

title: Lakshadweep divers bump into wreck of centuries-old warship - The Times of India
summary:

Publication Date: October 20, 2023 | Source: The Times of India

In a remarkable underwater discovery, divers off the coast of Lakshadweep have found the wreck of a warship believed to be centuries old, shedding light on the region's maritime history and potential archaeological significance.

  • Divers exploring the Lakshadweep waters stumbled upon a well-preserved shipwreck.
  • The ship is estimated to date back several centuries, possibly changing our understanding of regional maritime activities.
  • This discovery may lead to a series of underwater archaeological studies in the area.
  • The Warship is thought to be linked to significant historical events in the region.
“The wreck holds immense potential for historical research and could change what we know about the naval history of the region.” - Local Maritime Archaeologist

This finding opens up new avenues for research and will likely attract interest from historians and archaeologists alike.

title: Dangerous storm to unleash snow, ice, bitter cold across US - Hindustan Times
summary:
Dangerous Storm Set to Bring Snow, Ice, and Bitter Cold Across the US

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A colossal winter storm is set to hit the eastern half of the US, plunging more than 55 million people into a deep freeze with heavy snowfall, frigid temperatures, and hazardous travel conditions.

  • Winter storm warnings issued from Montana to Maryland, Delaware, and Virginia.
  • Heavy lake-effect snow expected in New York and Pennsylvania with totals possibly reaching two feet.
  • Blizzard conditions forecast across Central Plains, with travel being extremely hazardous.
  • Temperatures expected to drop below zero Fahrenheit in some areas, compounded by strong winds.
  • Freezing rain and sleet predicted to create treacherous conditions from Kansas to Virginia.
  • State emergencies declared in Missouri and Virginia due to hazardous weather risks.
Governor Andy Beshear stated, "The storm will likely cause significant disruption and dangerous conditions on our roads and could cause significant power outages just 24 hours before it's going to get really cold in Kentucky."

As the storm approaches, residents are urged to prepare for hazardous conditions and potential power outages.
newTitle: Dangerous Storm Set to Bring Snow, Ice, and Bitter Cold Across the US

title: 7 amazing images of Nebula captured by NASA - India.com

This article showcases stunning images of various nebulas captured by NASA, highlighting their beauty and scientific significance.

  • The Red Spider Nebula is located 3000 light-years away in Sagittarius.
  • The Spirograph Nebula, IC 418, lies 2000 light-years from Earth in Lepus.
  • Light and shadow in the Carina Nebula reveal complex structures.
  • The Twin Jet Nebula is a notable example of a bipolar planetary nebula.
  • The Hourglass Nebula MyCn18 is about 8,000 light-years away and is captured by Hubble.
  • The Crab Nebula offers the most detailed views ever.
  • A nebula resembling a butterfly is detailed for its unique shape.
"The Crab Nebula is among the most interesting and well-studied objects in astronomy."

The images celebrate the wonders of the universe and the role of NASA in cosmic exploration.

title: Couch potatoes beware! Sitting too much may lead to 19 serious health problems - The Times of India
summary:
Couch potatoes beware! Sitting too much may lead to 19 serious health problems

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Not specified

The dangers of a sedentary lifestyle are well-known, but a new study reveals a startling connection to 19 chronic conditions, urging individuals to adopt healthier habits.

  • The University of Iowa conducted a study on over 40,000 patients, linking inactivity to increased health risks.
  • Only 60% of respondents met the recommended exercise guidelines.
  • Active individuals showed significantly lower rates of obesity, depression, and hypertension.
  • Patients with no physical activity had an average of 2.16 chronic conditions compared to 1.17 in active individuals.
  • Chronic health conditions related to a sedentary lifestyle include obesity, diabetes, heart issues, and more.
  • Tips to overcome sedentary habits include regular breaks, incorporating exercise into daily routines, and setting activity goals.
“This two-question survey typically takes fewer than 30 seconds for a patient to complete, so it doesn’t interfere with their visit. But it can tell us a whole lot about that patient’s overall health.” - Lucas Carr

Increasing awareness about the effects of inactivity is crucial. Through lifestyle changes, individuals can significantly improve their health and mitigate associated risks.
newTitle: Couch potatoes beware! Sitting too much may lead to 19 serious health problems

Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar?: Explained - The Hindu
summary:
Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar?: Explained

Published: January 04, 2025, 11:05 pm IST

The article discusses the recent depreciation of the Indian rupee against the U.S. dollar, attributed mainly to foreign investor withdrawals and prevailing economic conditions.

  • The rupee breached the 85 mark against the U.S. dollar, reaching an all-time low of 85.81.
  • Factors affecting currency depreciation include monetary policy, foreign demand for goods, and inflation rates.
  • The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has intervened to support the rupee but foreign exchange reserves are at an eight-month low of $640 billion.
  • Long-term trends show the rupee's gradual depreciation is tied to high inflation rates compared to the U.S.
“Analysts believe the rupee’s depreciation would have been far worse if not for the RBI’s intervention to support the rupee against the dollar.”

In conclusion, the rupee's current depreciation reflects broader economic trends, investor behavior, and international monetary policy shifts, with implications for India's economic stability.
newTitle: Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar?: Explained

title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi; flight operations hit at IGI airport - The Hindu
summary:
Dense Fog Engulfs Delhi; Flight Operations Hit at IGI Airport

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: Unknown

Nearly 500 flights faced disruptions at Indira Gandhi International Airport due to severe fog impacting northern India.

The dense fog has resulted in significant travel delays and cancellations, severely impacting air traffic across multiple states.

  • 412 flights delayed by over 45 minutes.
  • 45 flights cancelled due to poor weather conditions.
  • 19 flights diverted to alternate airports.
  • Zero visibility reported in New Delhi, especially between 11:30 p.m. and 8:30 a.m.
  • Intense fog conditions affected flights in multiple northern cities, including Chandigarh and Srinagar.
“Dense fog causing low visibility in northern belt continues to impact flight operations even during daytime hours,” - IndiGo.

This weather phenomenon underscores the ongoing challenges posed by extreme fog in the winter months, emphasizing the need for improved infrastructural responses to such disruptions.
newTitle: Dense Fog Disrupts Flight Operations at Delhi's IGI Airport

title: Jasprit Bumrah Ruled Fit To Bat, But Decision On Bowling To Be Made On Day 3 Morning: Report - News18
Why public health nutrition policies need novelty, precise targeting - The Hindu
summary:
Why public health nutrition policies need novelty, precise targeting

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: The Lancet

This article discusses the slow progress toward achieving Global Nutrition Targets (GNTs) for maternal and child nutrition, emphasizing the need for innovative approaches and precise targeting to address both undernutrition and overnutrition.

  • Global Nutrition Targets aim to alleviate maternal and child malnutrition, with specific goals for stunting, anaemia, and overweight.
  • A recent evaluation indicated insufficient progress in 204 countries from 2012 to 2021, projecting few nations will meet the targets by 2030.
  • Key reasons for slow progress include poor program implementation and inadequate understanding of anaemia causes in India.
  • Children are at risk of metabolic overnutrition, emphasizing the need for dual focus on both undernutrition and overnutrition.
  • Current policies need to diversify dietary approaches rather than solely focusing on specific nutrients.
"The need of the hour is to zealously and precisely focus on double duty actions to simultaneously address the under- and over-nutrition burden."

In conclusion, the effectiveness of public health nutrition policies requires a novel approach that considers the complexities of nutrition, addressing both deficiencies and excesses to foster healthier outcomes for future generations.
newTitle: Why public health nutrition policies need novelty, precise targeting
